channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Two men indicted in 2002 killing of Run-DMC hip hop star Jam Master Jay
item.description: Ronald Washington and Karl Jordan are facing murder charges, prosecutors said Monday. They are accused of killing Jam Master Jay in a drug-related homicide in Queens in 2002.

item.title: Mum wows thousands after sharing how she cleaned dirty white sneakers and made them look brand new
item.description: An Australian woman has impressed thousands of other moms online after revealing how she transformed two pairs of well-worn white sneakers and made them look sparkling new.

item.title: Thousands of Wuhan revellers cram into a water park at the former COVID-19 epicentre
item.description: Pictures reveal the popular Wuhan Maya Beach Water Park being jam-packed by mask-free revellers as they stood shoulder to shoulder in water over the weekend despite the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.
item.media:description: The Wuhan Maya Beach Water Park is offering half price discounts for female visitors

item.title: King Felipe and Queen Letizia of Spain put on a united front in Ibiza amid King Juan Carlos scandal
item.description: King Felipe and Queen Letizia of Spain continued to put on a united front as they visited the island of Ibiza today. The pair enjoyed a child-free tour of the Monographic Museum and Necropolis.

item.title: Scientists using stem cells to rescue the nearly extinct Sumatran rhino, who number less than 80
item.description: Before the two last Sumatran rhinos in Malaysia died, scientists harvested their stem cells and plan to turn them into an embryo to be implanted into a surrogate.

item.title: Victoria Derbyshire reveals her 'father was violent' - and says she understands terror of lockdown
item.description: In tonight's episode of BBC's Panorama, Victoria Derbyshire investigated the impact of lockdown for those living with an abusive partner, revealing the scale of domestic violence during the crisis.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why face masks DO work, according to study
item.description: In scientific experiments at the University of Edinburgh's School of Engineering 'not a single droplet' was omitted by participants wearing a surgical face mask, the study claimed.

item.title: Coronavirus France: Riot police enforce Marseilles mask-wearing
item.description: The French government has sent 130 riot police officers to the Marseille region of France to help enforce mask requirements and control the scattered incidents of violence.

item.title: A-levels U-turn throws university admissions into chaos
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson has now lifted the cap on university places, revealing that institutions will not be fined for exceeding the previous limits. Pictured: Protest in South Staffordshire today.

item.title: LAX worker reveals the RUDEST stars she's met in the airport
item.description: Cindy, who is @_sincindy on TikTok, has dished about the A-listers who fly out of Los Angeles International Airport and rated their behavior in a series of videos.

item.title: GCSE students WILL get their teacher-estimated grades on Thursday
item.description: GCSE students will be able to receive their teacher's predicted grades this Thursday despite calls to have their grades delayed in the wake of the A-level results fiasco.

item.title: Son of notorious 'Lord of the Skies' drug kingpin Amado Carrillo is shot dead at his home
item.description: Mexican criminal organization expert analysts believe El Chapo's sons could be behind the murder of Julio César 'El Cesarín' Carrillo, son of the deceased Amado Carrillo.

item.title: Coronavirus: Lebanon cases surge after Beirut explosion
item.description: Lebanese medical officials are now urging for a two-week lockdown to try to contain the pandemic after the explosion at Beirut port earlier this month overwhelmed the city's hospitals.

item.title: Penguins first evolved almost 22 million years ago in Australia and New Zealand
item.description: Researchers led from Chile analysed penguin genomes to determine the evolutionary history of the flightless, aquatic birds.

item.title: Fashion tycoon Peter Nygard's sons accuse him of hiring sex worker girlfriend to rape them
item.description: Peter Nygard's biological sons made the stunning allegations against their Canadian fashion mogul father, 79, in a complaint filed Sunday in Manhattan federal court.

item.title: Eton College headmaster leads calls for the government to scrap 'unfair' A-level algorithm
item.description: Eton headmaster Simon Henderson said pupils had seen their grades downgraded. Now headteachers are said to be welcoming the Government U-turn on A-level policy.

item.title: Judge slams parents of boy, 18, who caused fatal BMW crash
item.description: William Sheriff, was handed a suspended sentence after admitting causing death by careless driving. Sheriff was driving a BMW weeks after passing his driving test when he caused the crash.

item.title: Obese 5ft 3in teenager drops TWO dress sizes in just six weeks
item.description: Lucy, 18, lives in Lightwater, Surrey, with her mother Rachel, who weighs 17 stone. The pair appear on 5STAR's It's Your Fault I'm Fat tonight and overhaul their unhealthy eating habits.

item.title: Urban explorers' photos from Coco Chanel's Scottish mansion
item.description: Famous guests of the Rosehall Estate near Lairg in Scotland, were Hugh Grosvenor, the Second Duke of Westminster and her the legendary fashion designer's friend Winston Churchill.

item.title: Couple caught having sex during Brazil council video conference
item.description: The chair of the meeting Leonel Brizola, who continued the discussion despite the scenes being relayed through the video feed.

item.title: Death Valley hits 130 DEGREES - the hottest temperature in 107 years
item.description: Death Valley in California saw temperatures hit 130 degrees on Sunday afternoon, in what may well be the hottest temperature ever recorded. It comes as a heatwave hits the west.

item.title: Italian girl, 15, 'is raped on the beach by two "unaccompanied minors"'
item.description: The Italian girl claimed she was raped while waiting for friends on Lignano beach, north-east Italy. Two raped her, according to local media, while a third stood by and watched.

item.title: Trump has narrowed the gap with Biden, poll shows
item.description: The survey found that Democratic candidate Joe Biden and his running mate, Sen. Kamala Harris had a 4-point advantage over Trump and Vice President Mike Pence at 50%-46%.

item.title: Facebook merges Instagram and Messenger adding more functions to Direct Messages
item.description: Facebook has merged Instagram and Messenger, bringing new features to Direct messages. The merger comes as government regulators investigate the breaking up of the social giant.

item.title: Grandson of Kazakhstan ex-president found dead in London
item.description: Aisultan Nazarbayev, 29, who was once groomed as a future leader of Kazakhstan and serenaded by Kayne West at his wedding is said to have died in London from suspected heart failure.

item.title: Feeling sleepy: Going out for evening drinks helps you sleep better at night
item.description: Researchers from the Karolinska Institute, Sweden, studied the behaviour and sleepiness of 641 working adults in Sweden, particularly on weekends and days off.

item.title: Giving unique names to children's toys helps infants distinguish between different objects
item.description: Parents can help their child's recognition skills early on by giving toys names and saying these names when they hand them over, a new study suggests.

item.title: Man stuck in water slide pipe at Arizona pool presumed dead
item.description: A man who got stuck in a pipe is presumed dead and emergency crews recovered his body early Monday at Eldorado Aquatic Park in Scottsdale, Arizona.

item.title: Major U-turn as A levels AND GCSEs will now be based on teachers' assessments
item.description: Regulator Ofqual confirmed that England would follow steps already taken by Scotland Wales and Northern Ireland after a controversial computer algorithm marked down thousands of teenagers.

item.title: Police stop wedding reception with 100 guests and fine another organiser for breaking Covid rules
item.description: Officers broke up the event at Waheed's Buffet and Banqueting Hall in Blackburn on Sunday, which breached strict local lockdown rules banning large gatherings.

item.title: Swimmers banned from Dover harbour sea due to E-coli bacteria
item.description: Test routines revealed 'above normal' levels of E-coli bacteria in the water and visitors at the Kent landmark were warned not to swim by the harbour until further notice.

item.title: Kylie Jenner exposes FAKE Instagram post that had fans believe she captioned post brown skinned girl
item.description: Kylie Jenner has hit back at claims that she used the caption 'brown skinned girl' on an Instagram post, which she has now exposed as fake.

item.title: Amber Heard hits back after being slammed for 'going braless' while visiting a Turkish mosque
item.description: Amber Heard has been slammed on social media for wearing 'inappropriate clothing' while visiting a Turkish mosque.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hope for immunity in survivors of mild infections
item.description: Recent studies suggest mild infections can result in sufficient immune responses to block the virus from invading a person's body again via not only antibodies but immune B and T cells.

item.title: Cardi B's WAP debuts at No. 1 on Billboard Hot 100 chart
item.description: The critically-acclaimed sex-positive song marked the 27-year-old Grammy winner's fourth No. 1 hit

item.title: Why NYC WON'T survive coronavirus: Entrepreneur outlines why the city is forever changed
item.description: James Altrucher, who co-owns a comedy club in the city and also describes himself as an angel investor and author, is among the many who have fled.

item.title: Smuggler gangs are offering migrants 'bronze, silver and gold package deals' to cross the Channel
item.description: A five-year-old girl is among 17 migrants to cross The Channel so far today. The figures have been released as it was revealed traffickers offer migrants package deals to cross.

item.title: Students mock government's exam U-turn on social media
item.description: Memes have mocked the authorities cack-handed approach to results by showing a car wedged between two walls and Homer Simpson disappearing into a hedge.

item.title: Jill Biden 'cheated on first husband with Joe', her ex claims
item.description: Joe Biden and his wife Jill have lied about how they started dating - they actually had an affair that broke up her first marriage, her first husband claims.

item.title: England's last major mine shuts its doors with thousands of years of coalmining nearing its end
item.description: The Bradley open-cast mine in Durham is extracting its last coal today, after almost 200 years in operation. Owners Banks Group applied to keep the mine until open 2021, but it was denied.

item.title: Rose McGowan claims director Alexander Payne played her a 'soft-core porn movie' at age 15
item.description: Rose McGowan has called for an 'acknowledgement and apology' from director Alexander Payne after claiming he played her a 'soft-core porn movie' when she was aged 15.

item.title: Man bought wife flowers after 'planting contaminated baby food'
item.description: Nigel Wright, 45, was seen on CCTV taking two jars off the shelf of the Tesco store in Lockerbie, before placing the contaminated jar in their place. He denies two counts of contaminating goods.

item.title: Five-foot-long boa constrictor found next to Thames in Chiswick
item.description: A 5ft Boa constrictor was spotted near Barnes Bridge in Chiswick. The snake was captured near the River Thames by the RSCPA on Sunday. Its size suggests that it had recently been abandoned .

item.title: Visit Lyme Regis - setting for The French Lieutenant's Woman
item.description: In an occasional series, we explore the story behind a book - plus find fabulous places to eat, drink and stay related to it. This week: The French Lieutenant's Woman by John Fowles.

item.title: A-level results chaos: Gavin Williamson must 'carry the can'
item.description: Gavin Williamson today apologised to students for the 'distress' caused by the Government's A-level results debacle as he announced a U-turn amid calls for him to quit.

item.title: Good news for men: People get better at multi-tasking by practising simple challenges
item.description: Practising doing several tasks at once results in improved information transfer between the putamen, deep in the brain, and the outer regions of the brain.

item.title: TV's Kirstie Allsopp on India, her favourite travel destination
item.description: This week TV presenter Kirstie Allsopp checks in to our travel Q&A. She talks about a blissful trip to the village of Beer in Devon, 'astounding' India - and more...

item.title: Portugal's president rescues two women when he spotted them struggling in the water off the Algarve
item.description: Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, 71, was filmed on Saturday swimming out to the two women after their canoe capsized off the Praia do Alvor beach in the Algarve.

item.title: The best residential staycation training courses in the UK
item.description: Every week our Holiday Hero Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at a brilliant holiday idea, doing all the legwork so you don't have to. This week: where to learn a new skill on a staycation.

item.title: Lynx could return to Scottish countryside
item.description: The Lynx UK Trust announced it could soon be reintroducing the lynx at a site in Queen Elizabeth Forest Park near Aberfoyle, Loch Lomond, following an ecological feasibility study.

item.title: Five care home staff sacked after whistle-blower told how worker 'bled dry' resident's bank account
item.description: An investigation at Larchfield care home in Leeds, West Yorkshire, was sparked in 2017 when a whistle-blower contacted the police.

item.title: Knorr changes the name of its 'Gypsy sauce' sold in Germany after it was deemed racist
item.description: Food company Knorr will change the name of its 'Zigeunersauce,' or 'gypsy sauce' to 'Paprika Sauce Hungarian Style,' the German weekly Bild am Sonntag reported Sunday.

item.title: Fury over plan for 'taxpayer handouts' to rescue troubled high street brands including Pizza Express
item.description: The Treasury is looking into ways of getting money into the companies behind a raft of high street names seen to be at risk of collapse. Among those that could be in line are Pizza Express and Prezzo.

item.title: James Nesbitt carries coffin at father's Castlerock funeral
item.description: James Nesbitt and his sisters listened to prayers for his late father and were also joined by footballers from the 91-year-old's favourite team ahead of the funeral near Coleraine, Northern Ireland today.

item.title: 5,000-year-old clay 'tablet' depicting how beer was made in southern Iraq sells for £175,000
item.description: The object lays claim to be the earliest known record of any personal name in history - indicated by a horizontal rectangle on the upper left-hand corner.

item.title: Soho before the gentrification: Fascinating photos show streets of London nightspot 70 years ago
item.description: London's Soho area was a hotspot for the UK's underworld in the mid-twentieth century. Photos show a spiv selling black market jewellery and the raucous revellers of The Fitzroy Tavern in 1949.

item.title: Skin-crawling moment camper's tent is covered in blood-sucking insects
item.description: Dr Alan Mackie, from Edinburgh, was camping at Gleann an t-Slugain, Aberdeenshire, when he was set upon by the mass of midges. The midges left itchy, red spots all the way up his leg.

item.title: Great white shark eats dead whale off Long Island coast
item.description: A lifeguard captured a shark feasting on whale off the coast of Long Island, New York. The short clips shows the shark take a bit of the dead animal and then swim into the lifeguard's jet ski.

item.title: Melania repeatedly refuses to hold Trump's hand in frosty exchange as they arrive in DC
item.description: The frosty encounter took place on Sunday evening when the president and first lady arrived at Joint Base Andrews in Washington DC after spending the weekend in New Jersey.

item.title: Climbers ignore social distancing rules at the top of Ben Nevis
item.description: More than 50 people can be seen queuing in close proximity as they wait to reach the Cairn and Trig point at the summit of Ben Nevis in Lochaber, Scotland on August 8.

item.title: Travel industry faces quarantine crisis: Airlines, Eurostar and ferry companies slash services
item.description: The travel industry was plunged further into crisis today as transport firms slashed capacity and routes as demand crashed over the Government's ever changing list of safe countries

item.title: Family of four spend £500 to stay night in children's tree house
item.description: Ollie and Kady Hammond booked the tiny 8ft by 6ft accommodation in Wiltshire for a 'mini break' with their children Beau, five, and Brooke, ten on Saturday.

item.title: Man has a nap on roof during six-hour stand-off with police before they arrest him
item.description: A man who scaled a roof of a house in Kilton Close, Stockton-On-Tees, and proceeded to take a nap has been arrested this afternoon, following a six-hour stand-off with police.

item.title: 1960s-born women as likely to be childless as WWII counterparts
item.description: Women born in the 1920s and 1960s were twice as likely to remain childless than those born immediately after the Second World War, new figures have revealed.

item.title: This Morning: Ruth Langsford apologises as guest swears
item.description: Ruth Langsford was forced to say sorry to This Morning viewers on Monday's live show, after their in-studio guest cursed on air.

item.title: Four-day week could save thousands of jobs lost due to coronavirus, Europe's biggest union says
item.description: Union chair Jorg Hofmann told German media that the shorter week would be 'the answer to structural changes in sectors such as the automotive industry,' which is evolving at a growing pace.

item.title: Chronic stress caused by Covid-19 pandemic will lead to a generation of babies being born smaller
item.description: British researchers looked over eight studies involving more than 8,200 pregnant women and over a million children and said stress during pregnancy was significantly linked to a lower birth weight.

item.title: Peter Butterworth was rejected for part playing himself in The Wooden Horse because he was too fat
item.description: Peter Butterworth was involved in an escape attempt at the Stalag Luft III camp in October 1943, during which prisoners were concealed in a gymnastic vaulting horse.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion activists hold NUDE protest to expose 'naked truth' about climate change
item.description: Protesters stripped off on King's Lawn on Sunday to protest Cambridge University investing £400million in the fossil fuel industry. Several demonstrations have been held at the establishment.

item.title: Terrified boaters scream for help as their vessel sinks during Trump boat parade
item.description: The boat on the Willamette River in Portland, Oregon was filled with water after more than 20 boats and personal watercraft flying President Trump flags zoomed past them on Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Office worker, 31, now makes up to £10,000 a DAY sharing sexy snaps on adult modelling site
item.description: Sheree Power, 31, from London, told Fabulous Digital she signed up to the adult modelling site Reveal Me - similar to OnlyFans - and says her friends and family are supportive.

item.title: Moment woman ambushes a small wedding ceremony in Hawaii for violating coronavirus regulations
item.description: An woman in Oahu, Hawaii, crashed a small wedding at Waimanalo Beach because they were reportedly violating COVID-19 guidelines and threatened to have them arrested

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Two fatalities in preliminary daily death toll
item.description: Department of Health figures show it is the lowest daily infection toll in almost a fortnight, since 670 new cases of coronavirus were announced on August 4.

item.title: Travellers set up camp next to Emmerdale studios and leave burning caravan behind
item.description: Travellers left a burning caravan next to ITV's headquarters in Leeds last week. Around 20 caravans pitched up last week before leaving yesterday.

item.title: Four young men killed as their car crashes into a house
item.description: Devastated friends and loved ones laid flowers at the scene on the A4 in Derry Hill, near Calne, Wiltshire, after the crash that killed four young men.

item.title: Face masks must be worn walking along beach in Tenerife and Lanzarote and Ibiza pool parties banned
item.description: Brits visiting the Canary Islands, including Tenerife and Lanzarote, will now have to wear masks on the beach as the regional government reinforces coronavirus safety regulations.

item.title: Loose Women's Carol McGiffin worries breast cancer will return
item.description: The ITV star, 60, - who has had the all clear for five years - said that she was forced to miss monthly appointments from February this year that are vital in monitoring if the condition had returned.

item.title: Prince Harry 'exchanged strong words with the Queen about one of her key aides'
item.description: Author Omid Scobie has claimed Harry made the exasperated call following a tussle with a key aide to the Queen, Angela Kelly, about which tiara Meghan would wear when the couple wed.

item.title: Public Health England denies it was responsible for mass testing shambles
item.description: Duncan Selbie, head of PHE, confirmed Number 10's plans to merge the body with the NHS Test and Trace programme to create a new agency designed to tackle the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Mother charged with murdering her autistic son, 10, is pictured arriving at court
item.description: A mother charged with murdering her autistic son, 10, was brought to court today as her celebrity photographer ex-husband told how he would never forget his 'beautiful' boy

item.title: White man knocked out on Tube by a punch after racist rant
item.description: Footage posted online shows the man in a heated confrontation with other passengers as the train pulls into Bank station in central London.

item.title: Bear hug! Adorable cubs cuddle their mom and clamber on top of her as they play in Alaska
item.description: The cubs, both six months old, are pictured snuggled up with their mother in some long grass in the Lake Clark National Park, Alaska before one of them boldly climbs up on top of her.

item.title: Belarus's opposition leader taking on the 'last dictator in Europe'
item.description: Svetlana Tikhanovkaya (pictured) ran for the presidency of Belarus after her husband was arrested and barred from the ballot in May.

item.title: Fears grow for missing girl, 13, who has not been seen since Sunday morning
item.description: Emma Sutherland has not been seen since she left her house in Oxgangs, Edinburgh at around 9am on August 16.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's new home has spooky past
item.description: DailyMail.com has learned that the home Harry and Meghan bought in Santa Barbara sits behind what used to be the estate of deeply troubled schizophrenic sex addict Stanley McCormick.

item.title: Stunning six-bedroom apartment styled by designer owner Jasper Conran goes on the market for £3.95m
item.description: For £3.95m homebuyers can snap up English fashion designer Jasper Conran's apartment. The impressive home is part of a Palladian mansion and has views over the Nadder Valley, Wiltshire.

item.title: 'Hero' new father, 24, beaten to death outside Wetherspoon pub
item.description: The victim, named locally as Reece Cox, was caught up in violence at a taxi rank near The Clifton in Sedgley, West Midlands at around midnight on Saturday.

item.title: Richard Hammond plans secure garage to protect luxury cars
item.description: TV presenter Richard Hammond has submitted plans to create a secure parking area for around a dozen cars and motorbikes he owns at his six-bedroom Herefordshire castle, near Ross-on-Wye.

item.title: Why smaller weddings are BETTER: Events planner explains pros of tying the knot with just 30 guests
item.description: With government covid-19 restrictions limiting weddings to a maximum of 30 guests, British wedding and events planner Katie Tottenham explains why smaller weddings could be the better option anyway.

item.title: Exercise: Turning a 12-minute stroll into a 7-minute power walk daily lowers the risk of early death
item.description: Experts led from Cambridge used fitness tracker data to show that, when it comes to longevity, it's not how much exercise you get but the intensity that matters.

item.title: Woman divides opinion with her 'traditional' English fry-up after adding garden peas
item.description: A woman, from the UK, known only as Jessica O, has taken to the Rate My Plate Twitter group and shared a photo of her English fry-up - which includes garden peas.

item.title: Jamie Oliver is given the go-ahead to build a greenhouse to grow vegetables in at his mansion
item.description: Jamie Oliver has been given the go-ahead to build a greenhouse to grow vegetables in at his £6 million Essex mansion.

item.title: Britons are 'more likely to die of cancer than they were 15 years ago' because of Covid-19
item.description: Beth Pattison, from Durham, rang her GP in March but was told her cough was merely down to Covid-19. She died on June 27 from breast cancer, which she had already beaten twice.

item.title: Last surviving golden eagle in Wales is found dead by walker
item.description: The golden eagle was found by a walker in the Abergwesyn Valley, Powys. lolo Williams described its death as 'more than the death of just an eagle'.

item.title: Russia says it's developing Covid-19 vaccine for mink and CATS after boasting about human treatment
item.description: Moscow is developing another 'groundbreaking' vaccine to protect mink in its vast fur farms, as well as domestic cats that is expected to be tested in the autumn following cases with cats in Moscow.

item.title: Arthur Edwards calls Princes Harry and William's rift 'a tragedy'
item.description: Arthur Edwards claimed on This Morning today that Prince Harry would 'go out of his way' to help him take pictures while on tour, and thinks his feud with Prince William 'must be over' Meghan Markle.

item.title: Easyjet cuts up to 670 jobs as Jet2 axes 102 pilots
item.description: Easyjet and Jet2 have announced the latest wave of job cuts to hit the aviation industry, with nearly 700 roles set to be axed.

item.title: North Korean asylum seeker claims she is victim of campaign of abuse by neighbour over their BINS
item.description: Footage shows the resident arguing with the woman, named as Myungseo, and appearing to throw a bin in her direction before pushing her outside her home in Croydon, London.

item.title: Restorers find historic family's secret cache of Catholic documents in National Trust stately home
item.description: An archaeologist found more than two thousand artefacts, thought to be hidden for Catholic worship by the Bedingfeld family in the 16th century, under floorboards at Oxburgh Hall, Norfolk.

item.title: Restaurant sales drop in second week of Eat Out to Help scheme
item.description: Sales collectively fell by 13 per cent between August 10 and 12 compared with the same Monday to Wednesday period a week earlier in the UK, according to research by hospitality software business Fourth.

item.title: Meghan Markle's hairdresser raves about her 'effortless looks'
item.description: London-based celebrity hairdresser George Northwood, spoke to Grazia magazine about working with the royal and said she is 'the most thoughtful person' down to the 'smallest detail'.

item.title: Tributes paid to one-year-old 'beautiful' girl who died in hospital
item.description: Elaina Rose Aziz was found 'seriously unwell' at a house in Nuneaton, Warwickshire, on the evening of August 6 and taken in cardiac arrest to hospital, where she died.

item.title: Adverts for sausage rolls, fish fingers and ketchup 'to be BANNED from daytime TV ads'
item.description: All food with more than 1.5g of salt are at risk of being barred from TV until after the 9pm watershed. It includes British cupboard staples such as ketchup, English mustard, Marmite and soy sauce.

item.title: Google launches 'misinformation' campaign warning Australians will lose free internet
item.description: Google has released an open letter to any Australian who uses its search engine - warning free internet searches will end because a proposed new law will make them pay for news content.

item.title: Conservative activist, 21, found dead 'took her own life'
item.description: Jade Smith, 21, who was found dead at the foot of cliffs in Saltburn on September 29, took her own life, an inquest has ruled. The Conservative activist was well-known for her Boris Johnson tattoo.

item.title: Car buyers can get 20% off new models as prices are cut
item.description: September is always one of the two biggest months for car sales along with March, but with Covid-19 strangling the sector in the third month, dealers are ready to strike deals - like 20% off a Nissan Qashqai.

item.title: Woman who had lockdown affair called 'selfish' by Mumsnet users
item.description: An anonymous woman, from the UK, has taken to Mumsnet and told how she cheated on her husband during lockdown. The affair lasted four months and she now wants to save her marriage.

item.title: Man kicked in head in road rage incident left with head injuries
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT:The 43-year-old victim hit the ground on the pavement in Stubbington Avenue in Portsmouth, Hampshire, and is still being treated in hospital for head injuries.

item.title: Huge spinning waterspout looms over the Bristol Channel as storms batter Britain
item.description: A huge funnel cloud appeared over the Bristol Channel yesterday which appeared to create a spray from the sea, while an extraordinary 'microburst' storm was filmed hitting the Peterborough area.

item.title: Smiling Tamara Ecclestone strokes her tummy in Gstaad
item.description: Tamara Ecclestone stroked her tummy while out during a walk with her daughter Sophia in Gstaad in Switzerland on Saturday.

item.title: Will GCSE results be delayed? As exam fiasco plumbs new depths, top Tories call for postponement
item.description: Lord Baker, who introduced the GCSE system, said this Thursday's results announcement should be delayed by two weeks to allow the grades to be revised.

item.title: Age-defying author who says he is often mistaken for being almost two decades younger than he is
item.description: Edson Brandao is an influencer, personal coach and writer who lives in Groningen, the Netherlands, and says a clean-living lifestyle keeps him looking young.

item.title: Father-of-two, 39, develops a six-pack OVERNIGHT to 'keep up with his wife' thanks to new treatment
item.description: Father-of-two Daniel Tills, 39, from Weston-super-mare, told FEMAIL how he underwent Vaser liposuction, which costs in the region of £15,000 and gave him an 'instant' six-pack.

item.title: Newborn 'with their umbilical cord still attached' is abandoned in a trash bin
item.description: The naked infant was found wrapped in a plastic bag when a delivery worker heard the baby crying while parking his motorbike nearby in the northern Chinese region Ningxia.

item.title: Stalker, 44, who bombarded BBC DJ Gilles Peterson with death threats is back behind bars
item.description: Sarah Jayne Rook, 44, screamed 'You will die' at Gilles Peterson, 55, as he left BBC Broadcasting House in Portland Place, London on March 21.

item.title: Mother-of-two sheds 16st and finds true love with a new man
item.description: Angela Snagg from Liverpool, who weighed 32 stone and wore a UK size 30 at her heaviest, revealed she's been able to shed half of her body weight since ditching her partner.

item.title: Senior Tory MP Tim Loughton suggests quarantining cross-channel migrants on cruise ships
item.description: Tim Loughton, whose East Worthing and Shoreham constituency is on the south coast, suggested stricter measures were needed to prevent an influx of coronavirus.

item.title: Adorable moment chipmunk joins woman for her morning coffee
item.description: A woman was sitting outside enjoying her coffee when she noticed a little chipmunk on the floor and invited him to join her for a breakfast banana in Needham, Massachusetts.

item.title: Almost HALF of all parents have argued with a child's grandparents over how to raise the youngster
item.description: For some families, what happens at grandma's house stays at grandma's house, but according to a new national poll differences in parenting styles lead to arguments.

item.title: 'Covid Bride' is slammed online after ranting about guests cancelling because of the pandemic
item.description: A bride believed to be from the US was slammed online after ranting at guests cancelling on her wedding due to coronavirus, and saying she didn't care about anyone but her husband.

item.title: Italy closes nightclubs for three weeks and orders masks to be worn in public at night
item.description: New Covid-19 cases in the past week in Italy, the first European country to be hit hard by the coronavirus, were more than double those registered three weeks ago, and especially prevalent in young people.

item.title: Border Force threatens to fine couple after they found asylum seeker hidden in their camper van
item.description: John and Debbie Marriott, from Worthing in West Sussex, discovered the man under the tarpaulin covering their bikes after arriving home in their camper van on August 10.

item.title: Tony Blair warns another national lockdown is 'impossible'
item.description: Tony Blair today warned it will not be possible to impose another UK-wide coronavirus lockdown as he claimed ministers had got the Government's travel quarantine policy 'wrong'.

item.title: Vet campaigning against puppy farms reveals how to spot an illegitimate breeder
item.description: Vet Marc Abraham, from Brighton, appeared on GMB today where he revealed how to spot an legitimate dog breeder including asking lots of questions and selling more than one breed of dog.

item.title: Wannabe influencer quizzed by police in Russia after posting video holding baby daughter by one leg
item.description: Igor Kravtasov, 35, from Moscow, a social media influencer, said babies should be treated like monkeys. His wife Darya Getmanskaya, 27, the girl's mother, has been detained for ten days.

item.title: Is it worth swapping a buy-to-let for a holiday let?
item.description: As foreign travel is curbed and staycations become more popular many investors are eyeing holiday lets as a potentially lucrative safe haven for their cash.

item.title: The VERY bizarre spots of bother owners have found their cats in
item.description: Cat owners from across the globe have shared hilarious images of their much-adored felines getting up to mischief. The amusing snap have been compiled in an online gallery by BoredPanda.

item.title: Mother-of-three carries out an unrecognisable transformation on £6,000 static caravan in Snowdonia
item.description: Joanna Kelley, 49, from, Cheslyn Hay, Staffordshire, bought the 2003 model static caravan in the Welsh countryside for £6000 in 2017 with her husband John, 50.

item.title: Tricky 15-question IQ quiz will put your brainpower to the test
item.description: Terry Stein, the high-brow creator of the Playbuzz quiz, claims only those with an IQ of 151 or over will succeed in his Maths and English challenge. So, are you ready to pit your wits?

item.title: Mother uses a DRILL to clean the soap scum from her shower screens
item.description: An Australian woman has used a sponge attached to a drill to scrub away soap scum from her shower screens with tremendous results.

item.title: UK students descend on Westminster for day three of angry protests
item.description: Hundreds of young demonstrators in Parliament Square lofted banners and placards with pictures of Gavin Williamson on them, calling for the education secretary to be sacked.
